dlgPart.npc_text: “What news do you bring me?” asks Antidas impatiently.

dlgAnsw.text: “The Guards made a deal with House Aurelian. Meru’s won’t last long now.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “It serves him right,” says Antidas, not looking very concerned. “Meru turned his back on me years ago and hid in that castle of his. I always knew that he’ll pay for it one day.”

dlgAnsw.text: “I came to ask you for help. You have enough men to break the siege and reinforce the garrison.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “You can’t be serious,” says Antidas, surprised. “Didn’t I just say that Meru had it coming? He betrayed me when I needed him the most and now you expect me to come to his aid? No!”

dlgAnsw.text: “How long will Teron last after Ganezzar falls?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“I’m not scared easily,” Antidas says dismissively. “If they want a fight, they will get one, but that’s a big if.
“Maybe Teron *is* next, in which case I’d rather meet the Aurelian legions with all my strength, not a half of it. Maybe the problem is Meru and if I side with him, leaving Teron weak and ill-defended, they will have no choice but to strike at me as well.”

dlgAnsw.text: “House Aurelian is too strong. Uniting with Meru is your only chance to keep them from swallowing up your domains. Once Ganezzar is taken, this chance will be gone for good.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “I thought so too once and it cost me almost everything. I'm not going to make the same mistake twice.”

“Without the Imperial Guards to hold me back, my army grows daily. Good fighting men flock to my banner because they know that House Daratan is destined to rise again. These men want to make history, <charname>! What choice do I have but to lead them in battle?” says Antidas, smiling smugly.

“When you bring me the ancient engines of war,” says Antidas. “Trust me, I’ve learned my lessons during the last war. Fate is a fickle mistress. She’s been known to grant her favors to the unworthy and turn away from the unprepared.”

dlgAnsw.text: “These men are mercenaries. They are loyal to the paymaster.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“All men wish to rise above primal instincts and serve a higher Cause. They could have sold their swords to anyone but they have chosen to serve *me*.
“Linos pays them but who’s better to handle such things than a man learned in the art of coins and ledgers? You don’t really expect me to hand out pay and keep notes, do you?”

“I’m the Lord of House Daratan,” says Antidas with pride, “not a guildmaster. Everyone in this town serves me one way or another. Linos has always been a loyal servant. Why should I exclude him and rob myself of his skills and counsel? The man has ambitions but he knows which side his bread is buttered.”

dlgAnsw.text: “The Guards made a deal with House Aurelian. Meru’s won’t last long now.”
Talk to Linos before you go.
